Message: The user completes the submission of the form

To upload audiences on News Break, you need to follow these steps:
1. Go to the 'Tools' tab and select 'Create an audience'.
2. Prepare a CSV file containing user identifiers such as email addresses or device IDs. Make sure the file is in the correct format (CSV file of SHA 256 Hashed Device ID or Email).
3. Upload the CSV file. Note that it can take up to more than 24 hours to process the data and create the audience.
4. Once the audience becomes available, you can select it to include or exclude in the Audience section at the ad set level when creating a campaign.
For more detailed information, you can refer to this article: [Introduction to Audience Management](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/26679465558669-Introduction-to-Audience-Management).
How to see list email addresses inside an audience?

Currently, News Break does not provide a feature to view the list of email addresses or user identifiers inside an audience once it has been uploaded. The platform focuses on privacy and security, so the details of the audience are not accessible after the upload. You can manage your audiences by including or excluding them in your campaigns, but you won't be able to see the individual email addresses or device IDs.
how to see the number of people in an audience

To see the number of people in an audience on News Break, follow these steps:
1. Go to the 'Tools' tab and select 'Audience Management'.
2. After uploading your CSV file, you can check the status in the Availability column.
3. Once the audience becomes available, you will be able to see the size of the audience in terms of the number of matched users.
For more detailed information, you can refer to this article: [Introduction to Audience Management](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/26679465558669-Introduction-to-Audience-Management).
How do i make a Email - SHA256 hashed csv?

To create a CSV file with SHA256 hashed email addresses, follow these steps:
1. Prepare a list of email addresses you want to include in your audience.
2. Use a tool or script to hash each email address using the SHA256 algorithm. You can use programming languages like Python, or online tools for hashing.
3. Save the hashed email addresses in a CSV file with one column and no title.
4. Ensure the file size is within the 100M limit.
For more detailed information, you can refer to this article: [Introduction to Audience Management](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/26679465558669-Introduction-to-Audience-Management).
how would i know if i uploaded a correct csv file format?

To ensure that you have uploaded a correct CSV file format for your audience on News Break, follow these steps:
1. Make sure your CSV file contains only one column with SHA256 hashed email addresses or device IDs, and no title.
2. The file size should not exceed 100M.
3. After uploading the CSV file, go to the 'Audience Management' section under the 'Tools' tab.
4. Check the status of your upload in the Availability column. If there are any errors or issues with the format, you will see a notification indicating what needs to be corrected.
For more detailed information, you can refer to this article: [Introduction to Audience Management](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/26679465558669-Introduction-to-Audience-Management).
